main event: A witness observed 1,500 lights near Venus and a big stationary saucer on April 6, 1956.
interesting points: The witness, a 14-year-old, reported seeing 50-100 lights around Venus each time he looked through the telescope., The large saucer was estimated to be 100 feet in diameter., The weather conditions were clear during the observation., The sighting lasted for about 15-20 minutes., Various conclusions from the report included balloons, aircraft, and astronomical possibilities but insufficient data for definite evaluation.
sighted object: 1,500 lights and a big round saucer
